answers.author: Paul Scher
answers.text:
Several approaches to Quality Assurance have emerged in over the years. Broadly speaking however, the task of increasing the reliability of technical information in official reports to meet the requirements of the end users requires five crucial procedures; planning, control, evaluation, correction, and documentation. Each of these procedures demands that certain specific standards be met to ensure that the report's results are valid. Naturally each quality assurance program must be tailored to the specific study. Without knowing the specifics of the technical report you intend to present to the city council, I have attached a number of documents dealing broadly with the issue of improving quality assurance. I hope they prove useful. 
    First among these documents is a pdf entitled Approach to Quality Assurance in Local Government Training, which was prepared by the United Nations and can be found at: http://europeandcis.undp.org/governance/lgdc/show/64206751-F203-1EE9-BB23EEB42FFF8AD1
    Second, a document entitled Rocky Flats Historical Public Exposures Study Technical Topic Papers: Quality Assurance for the Public Exposures Studies on Rocky Flats can be found at: http://www.cdphe.state.co.us/hm/rfhealth/quality.htm
    Finally, a pdf entitled Design Quality Control/Quality Assurance Program was prepared by the Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) and can be found at: http://www.oregon.gov/ODOT/HWY/OPL/docs/QA/qa_guidebook.pdf?ga=t
